article.title: The Kinematics of Quasar Broad Emission Line Regions Using a Disk-wind Model

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure depicts a schematic of a disk-wind model for a quasar. What does the variable "i" represent in this model?
choices: The distance to the observer
The opening angle of the wind
The inclination angle of the observer\'s line-of-sight to the accretion disk
The radius of the black hole

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the division of the wind into \'wind zones\'. What is the purpose of dividing the wind this way?
choices: To mimic the stratified structure of the wind and investigate how line properties change with distance from the central source.
To simulate the clumpiness of the wind material.
To account for the varying density of the intercloud medium.
To represent different levels of ionization within the wind.

multiple_choice_question.text: These figures display optically thin emission line profiles for polar and intermediate wind opening angles. What general trend can be observed in the line profiles as the inclination angle (i) increases?
choices: The lines become more redshifted and narrower.
The lines remain largely unchanged.
The lines become more symmetric and broader, with reduced blueshift.
The lines split into distinct double peaks.

multiple_choice_question.text: These figures compare optically thick emission line profiles for polar and intermediate wind opening angles. What is a key difference observed in the profiles compared to the optically thin cases?
choices: The profiles are generally broader for all wind opening angles.
The profiles are significantly more redshifted in the optically thick case.
The profiles for intermediate and equatorial winds are predominantly single-peaked, while polar winds can remain double-peaked.
The profiles exhibit a significant decrease in flux at higher inclination angles.

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula describes the poloidal velocity (v<sub>l</sub>) in the disk-wind model. What does the parameter "R<sub>z</sub>" signify in this context?
choices: The acceleration scale height, representing the point where the wind reaches half its terminal velocity.
The radius of the black hole.
The maximum velocity achieved by the wind.
The distance over which the wind is accelerated.
